title: 2430 - Study Up On This Impressive Vocabulary
description:
Take our 2 - minute quiz to discover your exact English fluency level and get a personalized study plan → https://cf.allearsenglish.com/fluency-quiz

Subscribe to this channel: https://rb.gy/pqu4sa 

Part of leading a vibrant life is continuing to learn, but not all study terms can be used for everyone- today get four ways to talk about learning and studying in English.

Listen and Subscribe to All Ears English:
Apple Podcasts: https://rb.gy/mdot2s
Spotify: https://rb.gy/vatkvb
Google Podcasts: https://rb.gy/cjehuh
_________________________________________________________ 

Follow All Ears English on social media: 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/all_ears_english/?hl=en
Website: https://www.allearsenglish.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/allearsenglish/
Email: support@allearsenglish.com 

About All Ears English:
Are you feeling stuck with your English? Many people study English but don’t actually learn it. We created a better way to learn English to help you move from stuck to fearless to fluent in English. Throw away your boring old textbook! You should feel inspired when you learn English. We believe the purpose of learning English is to connect with people. Don’t get stuck in perfection by focusing on your mistakes. Come hang out with Lindsay, Michelle, Jessica and Aubrey! We are here to help you relax, have fun, and learn real, natural English. #ielts #learnenglish #englishvocabulary #listeningskills #listeningpractice #listeningcomprehension #englishlearning

transcript.en: Hey there Aubrey.
transcript.zh: 嘿，奥布里。

transcript.en: How's it going today?
transcript.zh: 你今天过得怎么样？

transcript.en: I am. Excellent.
transcript.zh: 我啊。非常好。

transcript.en: Lindsay, I have a question for you.
transcript.zh: 林赛，我有个问题想问你。

transcript.en: Sure.
transcript.zh: 当然可以。

transcript.en: Have you read up on anything interesting lately?
transcript.zh: 你最近有没有读到什么有趣的东西？

keyword.explanation: （通过阅读）研究、了解。指通过阅读大量资料来获取某方面的信息或知识
keyword.en: I need to read up on the history of this region before my trip.
keyword.zh: 旅行前我需要阅读了解一下这个地区的历史。

transcript.en: That's a good question because my first thought is I, you know, I started a new book, but that doesn't really answer the question you're asking me.
transcript.zh: 这是个好问题，因为我首先想到的是，你知道，我开始读一本新书，但这好像没真正回答你的问题。

transcript.en: Have you read up on anything and Yeah.
transcript.zh: 你有没有读到什么……嗯，有的。

transcript.en: So this couldn't be like reading a novel, right?
transcript.zh: 所以这应该不是指读小说之类的，对吧？

transcript.en: No, no. It doesn't really answer the question.
transcript.zh: 不，不是的。那没真正回答你的问题。

transcript.en: So yeah, I'm always reading up on the news, Aubrey keeping, keeping up to date on what's happening.
transcript.zh: 所以是啊，奥布里，我总是通过阅读了解新闻，了解最新发生的事。

keyword.explanation: 了解最新情况、跟上……的最新动态。指持续关注并了解某事物的最新信息
keyword.en: She spends an hour each morning keeping up to date on industry news.
keyword.zh: 她每天早上花一小时了解行业新闻的最新动态。

transcript.en: Okay, nice. Perfect.
transcript.zh: 好的，不错。太好了。

transcript.en: I started reading, I know there's this kind of trendy popular theory.
transcript.zh: 我开始读，我知道有这么一种流行的热门理论。

transcript.en: Mel Robbins wrote this book, the Let Them Theory and my brother was really excited about it.
transcript.zh: 梅尔·罗宾斯写了这本书，《随他去吧理论》，我哥哥对它特别感兴趣。

transcript.en: So I started reading up on that theory and sort of anything related.
transcript.zh: 所以我开始阅读了解那个理论以及所有相关的东西。

transcript.en: So yeah, I've been reading up on the Let Them Theory.
transcript.zh: 所以是啊，我一直在阅读了解《随他去吧理论》。

transcript.en: Interesting. Had you heard of it, Lindsay?
transcript.zh: 有意思。林赛，你听说过这个理论吗？

transcript.en: Interesting. I've heard of it, but I don't know what it is.
transcript.zh: 有意思。我听说过，但不知道它是什么。

transcript.en: Real quick. What is it sort of of just like instead of trying to change people's minds or control, just let them, right.
transcript.zh: 简单说一下。它大概就是，与其试图改变别人的想法或控制别人，不如随他们去，对吧。

transcript.en: Whatever they're gonna do. Yeah, let them do it.
transcript.zh: 不管他们要做什么。对，就让他们去做。

transcript.en: Don't let it affect your attitude or your happiness.
transcript.zh: 不要让这影响你的态度或你的快乐。

transcript.en: Right. But it definitely goes into it more because you know, sometimes you, and there's also like, let me, okay, okay, I'll let you.
transcript.zh: 对。但它肯定还有更多内容，因为你知道，有时候你，而且还有比如，让我想想，好吧，好吧，我会让你的。

transcript.en: But also I need to let me do things that will help me reach my goals righting.
transcript.zh: 但我也需要让自己做那些能帮助我实现目标的事，对吧。

transcript.en: Got it. All right. Interesting.
transcript.zh: 明白了。好的。有意思。

transcript.en: I'll have to check. I'll have to read up on that.
transcript.zh: 我得去了解一下。我得阅读了解一下那个理论。

transcript.en: Aubrey, I'll have to read up.
transcript.zh: 奥布里，我得去阅读了解一下。

transcript.en: There you go. Something to read up on.
transcript.zh: 这就对了。有东西可以去阅读了解了。

transcript.en: This is interesting. This phrase came up.
transcript.zh: 这很有意思。这个短语出现了。

transcript.en: We had a great question and we're sharing some related phrases.
transcript.zh: 我们收到了一个很棒的问题，而且我们要分享一些相关的短语。

transcript.en: Do you wanna read the today's question for us?
transcript.zh: 你想给我们读一下今天的问题吗？

transcript.en: Yes. This question came in from Yge Kirk K and Yge says the other day, while I was talking to a friend from the US I mentioned that I had to study a lot that night and didn't have much time.
transcript.zh: 好的。这个问题来自伊格·柯克·K，伊格说前几天，我和一个美国朋友聊天时，我提到那天晚上我得好好学习，没多少时间。

transcript.en: She replied, so you'll hit the books, which I find quite funny and interesting.
transcript.zh: 她回答说，‘所以你要去啃书本啦’，我觉得这说法很有趣，也很好笑。

keyword.explanation: 英语俚语，意思是‘用功学习、啃书本’，特指为了学业（如考试、课程作业等）而进行的学习
keyword.en: I have a math exam tomorrow, so I need to hit the books tonight.
keyword.zh: 我明天有数学考试，所以今晚得用功学习了。

transcript.en: It's a phrase I hadn't heard before.
transcript.zh: 这是我以前没听过的短语。

transcript.en: That's why I thought this might be an idea for your podcast.
transcript.zh: 所以我觉得这可能是你们播客的一个好素材。

transcript.en: By the way, I recently discovered your podcast and I really enjoy listening to it.
transcript.zh: 顺便说一下，我最近发现了你们的播客，我真的很喜欢听。

transcript.en: Oh, that's great to know, Aubrey, isn't it?
transcript.zh: 哦，奥布里，知道这个真是太好了，对吧？

transcript.en: Yes. Awesome.
transcript.zh: 对。太棒了。

transcript.en: And I can totally see why this would seem like a really funny expression, right?
transcript.zh: 而且我完全能理解为什么这个表达看起来很有趣，对吧？

transcript.en: 'cause usually a hit is like a punch or maybe you hit something with your car.
transcript.zh: 因为通常‘hit’就像打一拳，或者你开车撞到什么东西。

transcript.en: So it seems weird that there's this idiom hit the book.
transcript.zh: 所以有‘hit the book’这个习语，听起来很奇怪。

transcript.en: So you imagine someone literally, yeah, hitting a book.
transcript.zh: 所以你会想象有人真的，对，在打一本书。

transcript.en: It does seem that's not what it means.
transcript.zh: 看起来它确实不是那个意思。

transcript.en: Totally agree. It's very strange. It's totally counterintuitive.
transcript.zh: 完全同意。这很奇怪。完全违反直觉。

keyword.explanation: 违反直觉的、与直觉相反的。指某事的实际情况或道理与人们凭直觉认为的不一样
keyword.en: It seems counterintuitive, but sometimes working less can make you more productive.
keyword.zh: 这看起来违反直觉，但有时候少工作反而能让你更有效率。

transcript.en: And we'll get into it today. But first guys, go ahead and hit this follow button.
transcript.zh: 我们今天会深入探讨它。但首先，朋友们，快去点击这个关注按钮。

transcript.en: Hit that follow button. If you just found the show, maybe your friend recommended it to you.
transcript.zh: 点击那个关注按钮。如果你刚发现这个节目，也许是朋友推荐给你的。

transcript.en: Make sure you're following the show so you get new episodes five days a week.
transcript.zh: 确保你关注了这个节目，这样你每周五天都能收到新剧集。

transcript.en: Okay. And I see what you did there. Hit the follow button, like you hit the books.
transcript.zh: 好的。我知道你刚才做了什么。点击关注按钮，就像你‘啃书本’一样。

transcript.en: It's funny, I often use hit when we don't really mean to hit anything.
transcript.zh: 很有趣，我经常在我们并不是真的要‘打’什么东西的时候用‘hit’这个词。

transcript.en: Very interesting. Good stuff. So yeah, let's talk about this phrase.
transcript.zh: 非常有趣。不错。所以，我们来谈谈这个短语吧。

transcript.en: Aubrey hit the books. Yeah. What does it mean first?
transcript.zh: 奥布里，‘hit the books’。对。它首先是什么意思？

transcript.en: Yeah, it means studying. It's very specific to schoolwork, right?
transcript.zh: 对，它的意思是学习。它特指学校作业，对吧？

transcript.en: If you are in classes, college, high school, and you have to study for an exam, you would say, I'm gonna hit the books.
transcript.zh: 如果你在上课，上大学、高中，而且你得为考试学习，你会说‘我要去啃书本了’。

transcript.en: If you're studying for the bar, right? For big exams, all that type of test, that's when we would say, I'm gonna hit the books.
transcript.zh: 如果你在准备律师资格考试，对吧？为大型考试，所有那种类型的考试，那时候我们会说‘我要去啃书本了’。

transcript.en: If you just need to study a lot. Yeah. Okay, good stuff.
transcript.zh: 如果你只是需要大量学习。对。好的，不错。

transcript.en: I need to hit the books. I have an exam tomorrow, for example.
transcript.zh: 比如，我明天有考试，我得去啃书本了。

transcript.en: Or again, he can't come to dinner. He's hitting the books tonight.
transcript.zh: 或者再比如，他不能来吃晚饭了。他今晚要啃书本。

transcript.en: Yeah, but what's interesting, yeah, he is not literally hitting a book.
transcript.zh: 对，但有趣的是，对，他并不是真的在打一本书。

transcript.en: It means he is studying. It's a funny way to say it. It's a very idiomatic.
transcript.zh: 它的意思是他在学习。这是一种有趣的说法。非常口语化、习语化。

keyword.explanation: 符合习语的、口语化的。指语言表达符合某一语言的习惯用法或习语特征
keyword.en: Using 'break a leg' to wish someone luck is idiomatic in English.
keyword.zh: 用‘break a leg’来祝某人好运在英语中是符合习语习惯的。

transcript.en: Exactly. But it's interesting to think about, you know, would you ever say this about work?
transcript.zh: 没错。但想想也挺有趣的，你知道，你会在工作场合用这个短语吗？

transcript.en: Maybe if you had to read a lot of manuals or read some instructions, would you say, I'm gonna hit the books?
transcript.zh: 也许如果你得读很多手册或一些说明书，你会说‘我要去啃书本了’吗？

transcript.en: It's a good question. You really wouldn't, this is especially reserved for being a student in school.
transcript.zh: 这是个好问题。你真的不会，这尤其用于在校学生。

transcript.en: Even if you are professional and you do study things, you, it's just, it just means you're in school. Hit the books. Exactly.
transcript.zh: 即使你是专业人士，而且你也学习东西，你，就是，它就意味着你是在校学生。‘Hit the books’。没错。

transcript.en: Yeah. So where I said, have you read up on anything lately? That's because I know you're not in school.
transcript.zh: 对。所以我问‘你最近有没有读到什么有趣的东西’，那是因为我知道你不在学校。

transcript.en: If I knew you were registered, you know, if you were doing a PhD, I might say, I might say, have you been hitting the books lately?
transcript.zh: 如果你注册入学了，你知道，如果你在读博士，我可能会说‘你最近一直在啃书本吗？’

transcript.en: But where I know you're not, I would say, or have you been reading up on anything? 'cause we still study. We still research.
transcript.zh: 但既然我知道你没在上学，我会说‘或者你最近有没有在阅读了解什么东西？’因为我们仍然会学习。我们仍然会研究。

transcript.en: Yes. When we're not enrolled in school, but we don't hit the books. Very interesting.
transcript.zh: 对。当我们没在上学的时候，但我们不会说‘hit the books’。非常有趣。

transcript.en: Yeah. I mean, I'm taking an online course on Coursera right now. Multiple ones about ai.
transcript.zh: 对。我是说，我现在在Coursera上在线课程。好几门关于人工智能的。

transcript.en: You know how to prompt ai, how to do it, and that. I still wouldn't say I'm hitting the books when it comes to ai.
transcript.zh: 你知道如何提示人工智能，如何操作之类的。但说到人工智能，我还是不会说我在‘啃书本’。

transcript.en: No, it doesn't work, Aubrey. It's a very narrow phrase, right? You're reading up on it.
transcript.zh: 不，这不行，奥布里。这是个范围很窄的短语，对吧？你是在阅读了解它。

transcript.en: That might be perfect for our next phrase here. We say study up on, study up on.
transcript.zh: 这可能正好引出我们下一个短语。我们说‘study up on’，‘study up on’。

keyword.explanation: （为某目的）专门研究、钻研。指为了获取��定知识或技能而进行有针对性的学习和研究
keyword.en: I need to study up on computer programming before applying for this job.
keyword.zh: 申请这份工作前，我需要专门研究一下计算机编程。

transcript.en: This is more flexible. This means we're studying or researching anything.
transcript.zh: 这个短语更灵活。它意思是我们在学习或研究任何东西。

transcript.en: So you are studying up on ai. Yeah.
transcript.zh: 所以你在专门研究人工智能。对。

transcript.en: For example, here are some sample sentences. I don't know much about that. Politician's views. I need to study up on it.
transcript.zh: 比如，这里有一些例句。我不太了解那个政客的观点。我需要专门研究一下。

transcript.en: Yeah. So you might do this before a big election. If you're not really tuned in all the time, you need to study up on views.
transcript.zh: 对。所以你可能会在大型选举前这么��。如果你不是一直关注，你需要专门研究一下他们的观点。

transcript.en: Or she's been studying up on emotional intelligence. I've been studying up on the Let them theory. Right?
transcript.zh: 或者她一直在专门研究情商。我一��在专门研究《随他去吧理论》。对吧？

transcript.en: So this, you don't have to be officially enrolled in any schooling. Anything you're researching or studying about, you could use this.
transcript.zh: 所以这个短语，你不必正式注册入学。任何你在研究或学习的东西，你都可以用它。

transcript.en: Yes, I love it. And then we move on to read up on now Hari, what is the difference between study up on and read up on?
transcript.zh: 是的，我喜欢这个短语。然后我们现在来说说‘read up on’，哈里，‘study up on’和‘read up on’有什么区别？

transcript.en: Yeah, these can be pretty synonymous, right? Yeah.
transcript.zh: 对，它们在很大程度上是同义词，对吧？对。

keyword.explanation: 同义的、同义词的。指不同词语可以互相替换而不改变句子的核心含义
keyword.zh: ‘快乐的’和‘愉快的’通常被认为是同义的。

transcript.en: If you, you could say you're reading up on ai. If you are reading a lot about it, reading articles, if you're reading the news, right?
transcript.zh: 如果你，你可以说你在阅读了解人工智能。如果你读了很多关于它的东西，读文章，读新闻，对吧？

transcript.en: This, if you study up on is more for something you're really researching, diving into, trying to study about.
transcript.zh: 而‘study up on’更多用于你真的在研究、深入钻研、努力学习的东西。

keyword.explanation: 深入钻研、深入探讨。指深入地研究或探讨某个主题或问题
keyword.en: She spent months diving into the history of ancient civilizations.
keyword.zh: 她花了几个月时间深入钻研古代文明史。

transcript.en: Whereas read up on just means you're reading a lot about, it's a little more narrow.
transcript.zh: 而‘read up on’只是意味着你读了很多关于它的东西，范围稍微窄一点。

transcript.en: Right? Maybe the umbrella term is study up on which you could be reading up on it, but you also could be, I don't know, taking quizzes or something.
transcript.zh: 对吧？也许‘study up on’是更宽泛的术语，你可能在阅读了解它，但你也可能在做测验之类的。

transcript.en: Exactly. Right. Whereas if you're just reading a lot about it, then you wouldn't say study up on just reading it. Reading up on it.
transcript.zh: 没错。对。而如果你只是读了很多关于它的东西，那你不会说‘study up on’，��会说‘reading up on it’。

transcript.en: For example, she's been reading up on emotional intelligence, right? Same thing. This just means maybe she's reading a lot of articles.
transcript.zh: 比如，她一直在阅读了解情商，对吧？同样的。这只是意味着她可能读了很多文章。

transcript.en: Oh. And here we have an AI example. Love it. Nice.
transcript.zh: 哦。这里我们有个人工智能的例子。太好了。不错。

transcript.en: I need to read up on ai. I feel like there's a lot I don't know about it. Right?
transcript.zh: 我需要阅读了解一下人工智能。我觉得我有很多不知道的。对吧？

transcript.en: Yeah. So these are pretty interchangeable, pretty synonymous.
transcript.zh: 对。所以它们在很大程度上可以互换，是同义词。

keyword.explanation: 可互换的、可交替的。指两个或��个事物在特定情况下可以相互替换使用
keyword.en: The parts of these two machines are interchangeable, making repairs easier.
keyword.zh: 这两台机器的零件可以互换，使得维修���简单。

transcript.en: Just anything You're reading a lot about studying, about researching online maybe.
transcript.zh: 就是任何你大量阅读、学习、可能在网上研究的东西。

transcript.en: Yeah. And I like the next one. Aubrey, did you use to cram for tests?
transcript.zh: 对。我喜欢下一个短语。奥布里，你以前考试前会临时抱佛脚吗？

keyword.explanation: 动词，意思是‘临时抱佛脚、突击学习’，指在短时间内（通常是考试前）快速大量地学习，尤其是在之前拖延了的情况下
keyword.en: He crammed for the final exam all night and barely passed.
keyword.zh: 他通宵为期末考试临时抱佛脚，勉强及格了。

transcript.en: Yes, absolutely. I was really bad at procrastinating.
transcript.zh: 是的，当然。我以前真的很会拖延。

keyword.explanation: 拖延、耽搁。指故意推迟或延迟做某事，尤其是应该做的事
keyword.en: Stop procrastinating and start working on your project.
keyword.zh: 别再拖延了，开始做你的项目吧。

transcript.en: And then the night before an exam, I'd be up all night long cramming.
transcript.zh: 然后考试前一晚，我会通宵熬夜临时抱佛脚。

transcript.en: Yeah, it's so, it's so bad. It's a common habit of high school kids, right?
transcript.zh: 对，这太，这太糟糕了。这是高中生的常见习惯，对吧？

transcript.en: They don't pay attention during the semester and then the night before, we have to jam everything in our brains and then we let it all out after we take the test.
transcript.zh: 他们整个学期都不认真听讲，然后考试前一晚，我们得把所有东西都塞进脑子里，考完试就全忘了。

transcript.en: Exactly right. This just means to study a lot at once, usually after procrastinating.
transcript.zh: 完全正确。它的意思就是一次性大量学习，通常是在拖延之后。

transcript.en: But this is a little more flexible, right? Hitting the books is just about like schooling.
transcript.zh: 但这个短语更灵活一点，对吧？‘Hit the books’只和学校学习有关。

transcript.en: If you also are supposed to give a presentation at work and you procrastinate it, then you could say, I'm gonna have to cram tonight.
transcript.zh: 如果你在工作中要做一个演示，而且你拖延了，那你可以说‘我今晚得临时抱佛脚了’。

transcript.en: There's a lot I have to learn before I write these slides. For example, something you're doing last minute.
transcript.zh: 在做这些幻灯片之前，我有很多东西要学。比如，你在最后一刻做的事情。

transcript.en: I think it's important though, because cramming is just, is about the act of getting information into your brain.
transcript.zh: 不过我觉得这很重要，因为‘cram’就是把信息塞进脑子里的行为。

transcript.en: So if you're cramming to get the info in your brain to then present it, that works.
transcript.zh: 所以如果你为了把信息塞进脑子里然后去做演示而临时抱佛脚，这是可以的。

transcript.en: But if you're exactly right, just hustling on the presentation, that would be another verb, right, Aubrey?
transcript.zh: 但如果你只是在赶做演示文稿，那就得用另一个动词了，对吧，奥布里？

transcript.en: Right. But this, if you, if there's a bunch you have to read before you create the slides. Yes.
transcript.zh: 对。但如果你在做幻灯片之前有一堆东西要读，那就可以用。是的。

transcript.en: There's a, you could, you could cram last minute for that. Yeah. Yep, yep. Really important to know that difference there.
transcript.zh: 这种情况下，你可以在最后一刻临时抱佛脚。对。是的，是的。知道这个区别真的很重要。

transcript.en: Good. We'll take a quick break and then we'll be back.
transcript.zh: 好的。我们稍作休息，然后回来。

transcript.en: Alright. Aubrey, role play time here We are classmates in this role play. Okay. Alright. You wanna start us out?
transcript.zh: 好了。奥布里，现在是角色扮演时间。在这个角色扮演中我们是同学。好的。好吧。你想先开始吗？

transcript.en: A few of us are hitting the books at a study session tonight if you want to come.
transcript.zh: 我们几个人今晚要一起学习用功，如果你想来的话。

transcript.en: Oh, thanks. I might take you up on that. I've got some serious cramming to do.
transcript.zh: 哦，谢谢。我可能会接受你的邀请。我有很重要的内容要临时抱佛脚学一下。

keyword.explanation: 接受你的提议、答应你的邀请。指同意对方提出的建议或邀请
keyword.en: Thanks for offering to help. I might take you up on that later.
keyword.zh: 谢谢你提出帮忙。我稍后可能会接受你的帮助。

transcript.en: What are you writing your thesis on?
transcript.zh: 你的论文写的是什么主题？

transcript.en: Gender identity. I've been studying up on how much one's gender affects their sense of self.
transcript.zh: 性别认同。我一直在专门研究一个人的性别对其自我意识的影响有多大。

transcript.en: Interesting. There's definitely something that's definitely something I'd like to read up on.
transcript.zh: 有意思。这绝对是我想阅读了解的东西。

transcript.en: Can I read your paper when it's finished?
transcript.zh: 你写完论文后我能看看吗？

transcript.en: Absolutely. Nice, nice, nice. So I definitely had to make us students here so that we could use hitting the books.
transcript.zh: 当然可以。不错，不错，不错。所以我肯定得让我们在这里扮演学生，这样我们才能用‘hit the books’这个短语。

transcript.en: Oh, yep. Exa. And that proves it. Right? It just doesn't apply unless you're a student in a, in a program.
transcript.zh: 哦，是的。没错。这就证明了。对吧？除非你是某个课程的学生，否则它就不适用。

transcript.en: Exactly. So you started us out by saying a few of us are hitting the books at a study session tonight.
transcript.zh: 没错。所以你一开始说‘我们几个人今晚要一起学习用功’。

transcript.en: So you were inviting me just meaning we're going to study together.
transcript.zh: 所以你邀请我，意思就是我们要一起学习。

transcript.en: And then you said thanks, I might take you up on that. I've got some serious cramming to do.
transcript.zh: 然后你说‘谢谢，我可能会接受你的邀请。我有很重要的内容要临时抱佛脚学一下。’

transcript.en: So you need to jam all this information into your head. Exactly.
transcript.zh: 所以你需要把所有这些信息塞进脑子里。没错。

transcript.en: I'm probably have been procrastinating. I'm not like, I'm good, I'm ready. I've been studying. No, I've got some cramming to do.
transcript.zh: 我可能一直拖延了。我不是那种‘我准备好了，我学完了’的状态。不，我得临时抱佛脚学一下。

transcript.en: Oh my God. Did you used to get nervous, Aubrey, for tests before you would take them in school?
transcript.zh: 哦我的天。奥布里，你以前在学校考试前会紧张吗？

transcript.en: Absolutely, yes. I remember the most nervous I ever was.
transcript.zh: 当然会，是的。我记得我最紧张的一次。

transcript.en: Someone told me they had taken the class before and they said, if you're confident with your grade, this teacher doesn't make you take the final.
transcript.zh: 有人告诉我他们以前上过这门课，他们说，如果你对自己的成绩有信心，这个老师不会让你参加期末考试。

transcript.en: He says, go you. You know you, you don't have to take it.
transcript.zh: 他会说‘去吧，你不用考了。’你知道的，你不用参加考试。

transcript.en: So I didn't study at all and I went the last day. But I was like, what if that student was wrong?
transcript.zh: 所以我根本没学习，最后一天去了学校。但我当时想，万一那个学生说错了怎么办？

transcript.en: And I find out I have to take the final. I hadn't studied at all, but then he was right.
transcript.zh: 万一我发现我必须参加期末考试。我根本没学习，但后来他是对的。

transcript.en: He was like, if you're happy, thank your grade. You don't have to take it. I saved all that time. I was so happy.
transcript.zh: 他说‘如果你对成绩满意，那就不用考了。’我节省了那么多时间。我太开心了。

transcript.en: Oh my gosh. Rumors, right? Good thing. It was true. Good thing it was true.
transcript.zh: 哦我的天。谣言，对吧？幸好。那是真的。幸好那是真的。

transcript.en: I know, right? 'cause I, I risked it there. It was kind of a gamble. It was risky.
transcript.zh: 我知道，对吧？因为我，我在那儿冒险了。那有点像赌博。很冒险。

keyword.explanation: 名词，意思是‘赌博、冒险行为’；动词，意思是‘赌博、冒险做’。指冒着失去某物的风险去做某事
keyword.en: Investing in that startup is a bit of a gamble, but it could pay off.
keyword.zh: 投资那家初创公司有点冒险，但可能会有回报。

transcript.en: Yeah. Gamble. All right. What did you say next? Aubrey?
transcript.zh: 对。赌博。好吧。你接下来想说什么？奥布里？

transcript.en: All right, so then you were asking what I'm writing my thesis on and I, let's see, you said that's definitely something I'd like to read up on.
transcript.zh: 好吧，然后你问我的论文写的是什么主题，我，让我想想，你说‘这绝对是我想阅读了解的东西。’

transcript.en: So, oh, the before that you said I've, I said I've been studying up on how much one's gender affects their sense of self.
transcript.zh: 所以，哦，在那之前你说我，我说‘我一直在专门研究一个人的性别对其自我意识的影响有多大。’

transcript.en: So this is interesting. It is. There is a little bit of a nuance here.
transcript.zh: 所以这很有趣。确实。这里面有一点细微的差别。

keyword.explanation: 细微差别、微妙之处。指意义、感情或表达上的细微差别
keyword.en: There's a subtle nuance between 'angry' and 'irritated'.
keyword.zh: ‘愤怒的’和‘恼怒的’之间有细微的差别。

transcript.en: Yeah. This imp applies that I am really researching. I'm studying, I'm looking at studies, case studies maybe. Right.
transcript.zh: 对。这意味着我真的在研究。我在学习，我在看研究报告，可能还有案例��究。对吧。

transcript.en: I'm diving into the material more to understand something rather than just reading articles for example.
transcript.zh: 比如，我在更深入地钻研材料来理解某件事，而不只是读文章。

transcript.en: Yeah. It's kind of like when you write a paper, like you write a master's thesis or a PhD, you do a literature review, right.
transcript.zh: 对。这有点像你写论文的时候，比如写硕士论文或博士论文，你要做文献综述，对吧。

transcript.en: You have to do that whole process where you review what's already been written. That would be a context to use setting up on.
transcript.zh: 你得完成整个回顾已有文献的过程。那就是使用‘study up on’的��境。

transcript.en: Exactly. Right. Right. You might even be creating studies, surveys and having to get input that way.
transcript.zh: 没错。对。对。你甚至可能在设计研究、做调查，并通过那种方式获取信息。

transcript.en: Right. Whereas read up on is what you said next. And that would just mean more like, I would like to read a lot about that.
transcript.zh: 对。而‘read up on’是你接下来所说的。它的意思更像是‘我想读很多关于那个的东西。’

transcript.en: You said. That's definitely something I'd like to read up on. All right. Excellent.
transcript.zh: 你说‘这绝对是我想阅读了解的东西。’好的。太棒了。

transcript.en: Aubrey, where should we leave our listeners for today's episode?
transcript.zh: 奥布里，今天这一集我们该给听众们留点什么呢？

transcript.en: I like this theme. The theme of these words because it's about staying up to date on things. It's about lifelong learning in a sense, isn't it?
transcript.zh: 我喜欢这个主题。这些短语的主题是关于了解最新动态。在某种意义上，这是关于终身学习的，不是吗？

keyword.explanation: 终身学习。指持续一生的学习过程，强调在人生各个阶段不断获取新知识、技能和经验
keyword.en: In today's fast - changing world, lifelong learning is essential for career development.
keyword.zh: 在当今快速变化的世界，终身学习对职业发展至关重要。

transcript.en: Yes, absolutely. We should all be lifelong learners. Right?
transcript.zh: 是的，当然。我们都应该成为终身学习者。对吧？

transcript.en: I know you guys are curious about the world. There's certainly something you are studying up on, reading up on.
transcript.zh: 我知道你们都对这个世界充满好奇。肯定有什么东西是你们正在专门研究、阅读了解的。

transcript.en: And I'm also glad to be that really grateful for this question because you could see how this would be confusing.
transcript.zh: 而且我也很高兴，真的很感谢这个问题，因为你能明白这会有多令人困惑。

transcript.en: You might accidentally ask someone at work if they're hitting the books when you know they're, they need to read a lot for a project.
transcript.zh: 你可能会不小心在工作场合问别人‘你在啃书本吗’，而你知道他们为了一个项目需要读很多东西。

transcript.en: So it's good to know that that's very specific to studies schooling that you would be enrolled in.
transcript.zh: 所以知道‘hit the books’特指你注册入学的学校学习是很好的。

transcript.en: Yeah. But keep in mind, if you're a professional and you're in like night school, you could hit the books, right?
transcript.zh: 对。但要记住，如果你是专业人士，而且在上夜校，你可以说‘hit the books’，对吧？

transcript.en: Absolutely. That's the other piece. As long as you're enrolled in a formal academic endeavor, that's the difference with hit the books I think Aubrey.
transcript.zh: 当然。这是另一点。我觉得，奥布里，只要你注册参加了正式的学术项目，这就是‘hit the books’的区别所在。

transcript.en: Yeah. Yes, exactly. And then for everything else, you can study up on it. We're reading up on it as we continue to, yeah. Be lifelong learners.
transcript.zh: 对。是的，没错。然后对于其他所有事情，你可以用‘study up on’。我们在继续阅读了解它们，是的，作为终身学习者。

transcript.en: You got it. Alright, good stuff guys. Hit the fall button if you wanna be a lifelong learner. With us, with All Ears English right here.
transcript.zh: 明白了。好了，不错啊，朋友们。如果你想成为终身学习者，就点击关注按钮。和我们一起，就在这里，和‘全耳英语’一起。

transcript.en: And Aubrey, I'll see you back here very soon. All right. Awesome. See you next time. Good stuff. Bye. Bye.
transcript.zh: 奥布里，我们很快会在这里再见。好的。太棒了。下次见。不错。拜拜。拜拜。
